messages.subject: Not so new member
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! My name is Leon, i m from Mexico. I ve been lurking around this group for about two or three years without posting even once. It s not like i didn t wanted
messages.messageBody:
Hi!

My name is Leon, i'm from Mexico. I've been lurking
around this group for about two or three years without
posting even once.

It's not like i didn't wanted to ask anything, if you
are a newbie, the information out there in
Samuraihistory.com should be enough for starters.

I have to thank you guys for changing my first
impression from samurai (hollywood point of view) to a
more accurate (i suppose) general overview.

Anyway, i've enjoyed the discussions between members
with lots of knowledge, like Tony, Kitsuno, and many
others, along with their websites.

So this is what i wanted to ask: I've been buying
lately two manga from dark horse, Lone wolf & cub and
Samurai executioner. Aside from these fictional
characters (well, i read somewhere that Yamada sama
did actually exist), is the information about the
organization of the social classes and structure of
society somewhat accurate?

Did Tenma-cho, and all that bureacracy that appears in
Samurai executioner was like that back then?

Simply put: are these sources reliable in historical
terms?

Thank you in advance for your comments.

León
